entry.title: Boundless Releases North Weald Airfield for XP11 and XP12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. Boundless has released their rendition of North Weald Airfield for X-Plane 11 and 12, a small General Aviation airfield in Essex, UK. Opened in 1916 as Royal Flying Corps Station North Weald Bassett Aerodrome by the Royal Flying Corps (predecessor to the Royal Air Force), and in 1918 it became a Royal Air Force airport. This airfield played an important role in defending British skies during WWII. Hawker Hurricanes stationed in North Weald Airfield saw action in Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain. Later on in the war, Norwegian squadrons were reassigned to this airfield. Between the 1940s and 60s, this aerodrome was used for RAF glider training. The last combat unit left North Weald in 1958, while the RAF completely withdrew in 1964, and since then this aerodrome has been classified as civilian. Today, North Weald sees over 40,000 movements on average per year and is home to a collection of vintage and veteran aircraft such as the P-51 Mustang, Hawker Hurricane, Supermarine Spitfire, Douglas Dakota, Curtiss Kittyhawk, as well as early jet aircraft such as Hawker Hunter, de Havilland Venom, de Havilland Vampire, Folland Gnat and BAC Jet Provost. North Weald Airfield will feature up-to-date orthophotos, 4K PBR airport buildings, 3D Forrest (XP12 only), 3D vegetation, 3D volumetric grass, Custom night lighting, realistic HD static aircraft, accurate ground markings including cracks and wear & tear, dynamic weather effects (XP12 only) and accurate airport layout based on latest charts. You can buy this scenery on the Boundless store for $13.75 USD. It requires around 970MB when installed. â Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight sim news!

entry.title: Sky-Additions Releases Paris-Vatry Airport for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Sky-Additions has recently released their rendition of Paris-Vatry Airport (LFOK) for Microsoft Flight Simulator. It serves the champagne region in Northeastern France and is close enough to Paris (135km) to be considered by Ryanair as one of the Parisian airports. As of 2018, the airport had a yearly average of 61,826 passengers. It was built as an air base in 1953, housing fifty fighters in three large hangars. When France withdrew from the integrated NATO structure in 1967, the Americans left the base, leading to its closure. The French Air Force then used it for training until the early 2000s, when it was sold to civil interests and converted into a civilian airport. Besides handling occasional passenger traffic, itâs also a training pilot site for many airlines, such as Air France, British Airways, Brussels Airlines, KLM, Transavia, Transavia France, and Swiss. Airbus has also used its relatively long runway for aircraft testing. Itâs served by Ryanair, with flights to Marrakech and Porto.Â The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with an up-to-date layout, a custom GSX profile, detailed environmental elements, realistic airport vehicles, custom ground markings, and more. â Itâs available onÂ SimMarketÂ for roughly $9.64, requiring at least 120.97 MB of free hard disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Aeroplane Heaven Releases Hawker Hurrican Mk.1 for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Aeroplane Heaven has recently released its version of the Hawker Hurricane Mk.1 for Microsoft Flight Simulator, a British fighter aircraft that first flew in 1935. The single-seater plane was built by Hawker Aircraft Ltd. and was initially used by the Royal Air Force (RAF). The aircraft was introduced in 1937 and a total of 14.487 planes were built between 1937 and 1944. Although it initially flew for the RAF, it was also used by other countries such as Australia, Belgium, Greece, Poland, and more throughout its lifespan. The new add-on comes with a range of features, including high-fidelity models, detailed features, animations, accurate flight dynamics, a variety of liveries, and more. entry.title: X-Crafts Updates Free E-Jets for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. X-Crafts have released an update for their freeware E-Jets, bringing the plane to version V3.0. This new version is compatible with X-Plane 12 and comes with many improvements and new features. The previous version (V2.5) remains compatible with X-Plane 11. The Embraer E-Jet family consists of a multitude of Brazilian-made narrow-body airliners. The project was initially revealed by Embraer in 1997, but it was not officially unveiled until two years later. In 2002, the first E-Jet had its maiden flight. The E-Jet family comprises of four commercial airliners, including the E170, E175, E190, and E195. The free E-Jets series by X-Crafts includes both the E175 and the E195 models. The new X-Plane 12 version of the E-Jets comes with a range of new features, such as an enhanced flight model, improved modeling, updated lights, cockpit fixes, and more. The new version is now available for download on the X-Crafts website. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!
